We are delightful to introduce the most anticipated event this year "GDG DevFest Cairo 2016" organized by GDG Cairo and GDG New Cairo.

GDG DevFests are large, community-run events that offer speaker sessions across multiple product areas, all-day hack-a-thons, code labs, and much more.

More than 140 GDG DevFest events are hosted this year around the world, and we are proud to be participating in this global series for the fourth time in a row with GDG DevFest Cairo 2016.

Registration Form: http://bit.ly/DevFestCairo16

GDG DevFest Cairo 2016 Topics:
- Firebase - The New Google Platform!
- Do's and Dont's of Social Media Marketing for Mobile Apps
- Design Thinking
- It's All About Marketing
- React Native + Firebase to Create a Messaging App
- Firebase - Getting Started for Android

For more information regarding the GDG DevFest Season 2016, kindly check the following link: https://developers.google.com/events/devfest/

The GUC Orientation is a grand annual event that takes place in the GUC Campus. The event aims to orient each year newcomers in their academic and social life through a full program that includes specialized days for each faculty, along with an open day that serves to bond the freshmen together in their new community.

As for the enrolled GUC students, the waiting is over! The registration of the Team Leaders positions is few hours away. All student are urged to apply for this position, as we guarantee that this year's event is totally fresh and different. If you think that you have what it takes to lead, don't hesitate to fill the application (To be launched within few hours) 

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

This year Team Leaders Job Descriptions is as follows:

- Team Leader General Job Description:

1. Set short term goals and targets
2. Recruitment of team members though the interviews phase
3. Evaluate, document and Write reports about team and individual performance
4. Motivate and build the bond between team members
5. Develop and train team members in all needed fields 
6. Manage all sorts of dilemmas


â€¢	Welcoming & Tours Team Leader:

1. Design the tours route and intended goals
2. Manage guests flow from gates to seating area
3. Coordinate the tours timing and punctuality

â€¢	Information Center Team Leader:

1. Design the database for newcomers
2. Ensure full awareness of all team members of all needed information
3. Manage distribution and handling of packages
4. Coordinate the flow between information desks

â€¢	Hosting & Seating Team Leader:

1.	Handle all different situations in the seating area
2. Coordinate the guidance of students to the parents
3. Manage seating of the guests in the seating area
4. Follow the progress of program inside the area

â€¢	Clubs Coordination Team Leader:

1. Coordinate with GUC clubs (active working groups) through the orientation days
2. Design with GUC clubs (active working groups) the program and preparation of the open day
3. Manage all logistics and materials related to the open day

â€¢	Design & Social Media Team Leader:

1. Manage the event page and set its marketing plan
2. Supervise the media coverage through the orientation days and the open day
3. Coordinate with other team leaders to set and finalize the needed designs
4. Produce all students' related videos during the event

column1: GUC COMPLAINT  " Lack of parking spaces + Opening gate 2 for students"
column2:
If you are a GUCian who comes to campus by car and is fed of spending more than 30 minutes each day to find a parking spot for you car that is reasonably near the acessible gates as well as not having enough open gates for students. 
This is a formal complaint that is going to be presented to the customerâ€™s service department in university to complain about the current parking situation, demand a fast solution for it, and request the opening of gate two for students. 
If you agree with the following complaint  here is what you need to do:

1- Please take the time to sign this petition by clicking on this link  -------->>>>>>>>
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1eFoa5uDOnhAUFP9mlpvOBvtNbV4mcgPUAu3qYUY3Tq8/viewform
(Pressing "Going" on the event DOESN'T COUNT , you signiture is only counted when you FILL THE ONLINE FORM IN THE ABOVE LINK)

2- Invite your friends

3- Share the event on ur timeline

PS: You guys need to fill the online form above , likes and RSVPs alone don't count

The complaint goes as follows, 
"To whom it may concern this petition is presented to you on behalf of the students who signed it to object on the current parking situation in university. Since last year's tragic incident that resulted in the death of our colleague Yara Tarek, the university took decisions concerning the redistribution of the buses to avoid the occurrence of such accidents in the future; the decisions that were taken completely disregarded other factors such as car parking spaces. Because of the decrease in the area of parking, the remaining area dedicated for the studentsâ€™ cars does not even cover quarter of the number of the enrolled students with cars and as a result the students have to park outside the university campus. This, in turn, makes the students walk long distances to and from their classes. In fact, the further students park from an open gate, the longer they walk outside the university's campus and the more their safety is threatened as they become at risk of harassment, robbery, or even car theft in some cases. In addition, some students in majors such as Architecture or Applied arts carry a lot of tools or models, and walking long distances carrying these tools and models is very hard and tiring; first, because of the distance and second, because of the sloped topography of the land. In light of the apparently threatening and unpleasant situation, we urge you to take action concerning the highlighted issues by finding a fast solution for the parking situation in order to improve the studentsâ€™ campus lives and decrease the threats that accompany parking outside of campus. Until the improvement of the parking situation we request the opening of gate 2 for students; the gate is already open with security personnel it only lacks electronic gates. Opening gate 2 for students will reduce the distance that they have to walk especially if they have parked in the street between Arabella compound and the university. The distance between gates 1 and 4, which are already open for students, is about 626 meters long, according to google earth; that is more than half a kilometer of sloped ground that does not have any gates in between to serve as access. Consequently, opening gate 2 for students will make life easier for many of us who take classes in the B or the C buildings, as well as reduce the distance for those of us who take classes in the D building who already walk a very long distance inside of campus. In the end, we would like to thank you for receiving our complaints and suggestions and hope that you will consider them at the nearest convenience."
If you support this petition you are kindly requested to fill the following information so that the list of signatures is presented alongside the complaint.
